title: Does iMessage Give Notifications When You Save a Photo?

steps.title: No—other Messages (iMessage) users won't be notified.
steps.content: No—other Messages (iMessage) users won't be notified. Unlike Snapchat, which notifies others , you'll be able to save iMessages photos, videos, attachments, and texts without needing to worry about anyone else getting a notification. At the same time, you won't be notified if the recipient saves one of your attachments or chats. If you have read receipts enabled, the other person will only know that you saw their message. You can disable read receipts at any time. If you want to save a conversation, you can take a screenshot .

steps.title: Open the Messages app.
steps.content: Open the Messages app. This looks like a white speech bubble with a green background. [1] X Research source Make sure to update your iPhone or iPad to the latest version.

steps.title: Navigate to a conversation.
steps.content: Navigate to a conversation. You'll a list of your messages from most recent to least recent. If you have pinned messages , they'll appear at the top.

steps.title: Locate the picture or video.
steps.content: Locate the picture or video. If you want to save a recent picture or video, you can scroll up in the chat window.

steps.title: Click the download icon.
steps.content: Click the download icon. This will be to the right of the picture in the chat window. After clicking the icon, the picture or video will begin downloading to your device. You'll see a checkmark when it's finished, and the download icon will disappear.

steps.title: Open the Photos app.
steps.content: Open the Photos app. The picture you saved will be in the Recents album, at the very bottom.

steps.title: Save a non-recent photo (optional).
steps.content: Save a non-recent photo (optional). If you want to save a photo sent in the past, tap the contact name in the chat window. A new window will open. Tap See All underneath the Photos header. Tap the photo you want to save. Tap the Share icon in the bottom-left corner. A pop-up menu will open. Tap Save Image or Save Video . Your picture or video will be saved to the Recents album in the Photos app. If needed, you can also access Messages on iCloud to find synced messages.

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This looks like a grey cog icon. Use this method to disable read receipts on the Messages app. Recipients will only see that their messages have been delivered.

steps.title: Tap Messages.
steps.content: Tap Messages . You'll need to scroll down to find this.

steps.title: Toggle off "Send Read Receipts".
steps.content: Toggle off "Send Read Receipts". The switch will turn grey.

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This looks like a grey cog icon. Use this method to disable the "Shared with You" feature that shows you photos from Messages in your Photos app.

steps.title: Tap Messages.
steps.content: Tap Messages . You'll need to scroll down to find this.

steps.title: Toggle off "Shared with You".
steps.content: Toggle off "Shared with You". The switch will turn grey.
